CHINA AIRWAYS FEDERAL INC. U. S. A.
CABLE ADDRESS: "PACAMAIR"
51 CANTON ROAD
SHANGHAI
Person
e
29 August, 1935
Mr.
S.M.
Morgan,
Pacific American Airways,
135 East Forty-second St.,
New York City, N.Y.
Dear Mr. Morgan,
I like Chinese
chow and
frequently work
out with the sticks but
there are times when it is a
bit
trying. -
I am enclosing an invitation from Mr.
M.Y. Tang and a menu of
the dinner.
You will note item four
on
the menu.
It is considered polite among Chinese to use your own
sticks (which, of course, you constantly put in your mouth)
to
remove choice
morsels
from the center, common source
of supply.
Because I
don't like to eat food which others have deposited with
their
chop
sticks
on my plate I am always extremely polite and
usually manage to beat
them to the draw.
That system worked very
well
the other night until the fourth item on the menu came along.
Then,
left
while
I was
waiting on Mrs. Tang,
the Chinese lady on my
waited
on me by depositing
on my plate the foot
of
a chicken,
a great
delicacy,
which
had to
devour
or lose a lot of face,
in
fact,
be
quite
insulting.
So far as flavor,
for which
chicken
concerned I would much
rather work out on an
feet are fanni chins about as much but under more
tube,
ditions
sanitary con-
than a Chinese
chicken.
When
I was
attacking
the city I worried
lot
in Kweiyang with Communists
a,s
to
whether
I should let
the airplane fly away without me so as
to see
Chiang Kai
Shek or
go with
the plane.
Finally,
when the missionaries decided to
leave I made up my mind
that if the missionaries wouldn't stick
it
out for
Jesus
that there was no particular point
in my
sticking
out for Juan.
I'm glad that the Communists were eventu-
ally defeated but I'm still sorry that that chicken was.
Sincerely,
H.M. Bixby
it
SAVE
TIME
